creature.name: Corrupt Shieldmarshal
items: {@runeItem clan pistol|G&G|+1 weapon potency|} or {@runeItem clan pistol|G&G|+1 weapon potency|}

bot.name: Firearms Critical Specialization
entries: When the shieldmarshal makes a critical hit with a firearm weapon, the target must succeed at a DC 25 Fortitude save or be {@condition stunned||stunned 1}.

bot.name: Lawbringer
entries: The shieldmarshal marks a foe for judgment, granting the shieldmarshal a +10-foot circumstance bonus to Speed whenever it Strides toward that creature.
The shieldmarshal's Strikes against that creature deal an additional {@damage 2d8} precision damage.

bot.name: Reloading Strike
entries: The shieldmarshal makes a melee {@action Strike} against an opponent within reach and Interacts to reload a firearm in their other hand.

top.name: Private Detective
entries: The Leadsmith spends 1 minute examining a subject for clues. For the next 24 hours, whenever the Leadsmith makes a {@skill Perception} check or a skill check using Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma to {@action Recall Knowledge} about this subject, the Leadsmith gains a +2 circumstance bonus to the check.

bot.name: Bully Effect
entries: The Leadsmith's melee and ranged Strikes deal an additional {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage to creatures that were {@action Shove||Shoved} within the past round.

bot.name: Clear a Path
bot.requirements: The Leadsmith is wielding a firearm or crossbow in one hand, and their other hand either wields a one-handed melee weapon or is empty
entries: The Leadsmith makes a melee attack and then reloads their gun in one fluid movement. The Leadsmith makes a one-handed melee weapon {@action Strike} or unarmed {@action Strike} against an opponent within reach, then Interacts to reload. The Leadsmith doesn't need a free hand to reload in this way.

creature.name: Vewslog
items: +1 striking dueling pistol (2; 40 rounds; Guns & Gears 152)

attacks.name: dueling pistol
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d6+3} piercing plus {@damage 4d6} precision Deadeye Vewslog's ranged attacks deal an additional {@damage 4d6} precision damage.

mid.name: Flash of Insight
mid.trigger: Vewslog is about to roll a d20
entries: The cyclops peers into an occluded spectrum of possible futures. He gets a success (but not a critical success) on the roll instead of rolling.

mid.name: Pistolero's Retort
mid.trigger: A foe within 60 feet critically fails an attack roll against Vewslog
entries: Vewslog makes a dueling pistol {@action Strike} against the triggering foe.

bot.name: Firearms Critical Specialization
entries: When Vewslog makes a critical hit with a firearm, the target must succeed at a

bot.name: DC 25
entries: Fortitude save or become {@condition stunned||stunned 1}.

creature.name: Mutant Bats

top.name: Echolocation
entries: A bat can use its hearing as a precise sense at the listed range.

mid.name: Wing Thrash
mid.trigger: An adjacent enemy damages the mutant bat
entries: The bat makes one or two wing Strikes—one against the triggering creature and one against another adjacent creature.

creature.description: Mana Wastes mutated giant bats (Pathfinder Bestiary 39)

top.name: Slow
entries: A shambler horde is permanently {@condition slowed||slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

bot.name: Grave Tide
entries: The shambler troop is less organized than most troops. It can move into other creatures' spaces, and other creatures can move into its spaces. Its spaces are difficult terrain to other creatures.

bot.name: Shambling Onslaught
entries: The shamblers lash out at any enemies in their squares or within 5 feet (DC 25 basic Reflex save). The damage depends on the number of actions.
{@as 1} {@damage 3d6+9} bludgeoning damage {@as 2} {@damage 3d8+13} bludgeoning damage

bot.name: Troop Movement
entries: Whenever a troop Strides, it first Forms Up as a free action to condense into a 20-foot-by-20-foot area (minus any missing squares), then moves up to its Speed. This works just like a Gargantuan creature moving; for instance, if any square of the troop enters difficult terrain, the extra movement cost applies to the whole troop.

top.name: Wind-Up
entries: 24 hours, DC 29, standby

mid.name: Vulnerable to Shatter
entries: The glass elephant is affected by the {@spell shatter} spell as though it were an unattended object.

mid.name: Spell Reflection
mid.trigger: The glass elephant is targeted by a spell
entries: The elephant positions its reflective magical surfaces to turn the spell back on the caster. It tries to counteract the spell, making an {@skill Athletics} check for its counteract check. If it successfully counteracts the spell, the effect is turned back on the caster.

bot.name: Dual Tusks
entries: The glass elephant makes two tusk Strikes, each against a different creature. This counts as one attack for the elephant's multiple attack penalty, and the penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks.

bot.name: Grabbing Trunk A
entries: Medium or smaller creature hit by the glass elephant's trunk is {@condition grabbed}. If the elephant moves, it can bring the {@condition grabbed} creature along with it.

bot.name: Trample
entries: Large or smaller, foot, DC 32

top.name: Wind Up
entries: 24 hours, DC 26, standby

bot.name: Firearms Critical Specialization
entries: When the buccaneer makes a critical hit with a firearm, the target must succeed at a DC 28 Fortitude save or be {@condition stunned||stunned 1}.

bot.name: Pirate's Feint
entries: The clockwork buccaneer Feints. If the target becomes {@condition flat-footed} to the buccaneer's melee attacks, it becomes {@condition flat-footed} to the buccaneer's ranged attacks as well.

bot.name: Refill Tank
bot.requirements: The clockwork buccaneer is within 15 feet of a water source containing at least 100 gallons of water
entries: The clockwork buccaneer extends a clockwork tube and sucks up water to refill its water tank.

bot.name: Sneak Attack
entries: The clockwork buccaneer deals an extra {@damage 2d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.

bot.name: Water Jet
bot.requirements: The clockwork buccaneer has a full water tank
entries: The clockwork buccaneer fires a narrow but highly pressurized blast of water in a 60-foot line, dealing {@damage 10d6} bludgeoning damage to creatures and unattended objects in the area (DC 28 basic Fortitude save; unattended objects automatically fail). Creatures and objects that fail the save are also knocked back 5 feet (10 feet on a critical failure). This empties the buccaneer's water tank.

bot.name: Water Jump
bot.requirements: The clockwork buccaneer has a full water tank
entries: The clockwork buccaneer jumps 60 feet, propelling itself through the air with a jet of water. This empties the buccaneer's water tank.

top.name: Wind Up
entries: 24 hours, DC 22, standby

mid.name: Clockwork Swarm
entries: 30 feet. A cloud of flying, spiderlike clockworks surrounds the clockwork puppeteer. A creature that ends its turn in the cloud takes {@damage 4d8} piercing damage (DC 29 basic Reflex save).

bot.name: Clockwork String
entries: Any creature hit by the puppeteer's string is {@condition grabbed}. The puppeteer can move while it has a creature {@condition grabbed} with its string, but it automatically releases the creature if the puppeteer moves beyond the string's 60-foot length. The puppeteer can use up to six strings at a time. It can release any creature {@condition grabbed} by a string as a free action. Each string has AC 30, and its {@action Escape} DC is 32.
A string can be severed by a {@action Strike} that deals at least 20 slashing damage to it. This doesn't deal any damage to the clockwork puppeteer.

bot.name: Create Puppet
bot.trigger: A creature {@condition grabbed} by the puppeteer's clockwork string dies
entries: The triggering creature's body becomes infested with tiny clockworks.

This puppet is fully under the clockwork puppeteer's control and has statistics identical to a zombie of its size (Bestiary 340) with the following exceptions: It loses the {@trait undead} trait, loses negative healing, loses its weakness to positive damage, and gains the {@trait construct} trait.

bot.name: Pull String
entries: The puppeteer reins in a creature {@condition grabbed} by its string. The puppeteer attempts an {@skill Athletics} check against the creature's

bot.name: Fortitude DC.
entries: On a success, the puppeteer pulls the creature 15 feet closer to it (30 feet closer on a critical success).

languages: any languages spoken by its preserved heads

lore.note: any known by its preserved heads

top.name: Undead Crafter
entries: The cranium preserver knows one version of the create undead ritual for every four heads it has preserved (a typical cranium preserver has 12 preserved heads). The cranium preserver can use its heads to make separate rolls as both the primary and secondary casters of the ritual.

bot.name: Jettison Cranium
entries: The cranium preserver ejects one of its preserved-head jars at a point within 100 feet. The jar explodes, and all creatures in a 10-foot burst must attempt a DC 28 Will save.

Success: The creature takes {@damage 2d8} mental damage and {@damage 2d8} negative damage.
Failure: The creature takes {@damage 4d8} mental damage and {@damage 4d8} negative damage. The discharged mental anguish released from the preserved head causes the creature to become {@condition confused} for 1 round.
Critical Failure: The creature takes {@damage 8d8} mental and {@damage 8d8} negative damage. The discharged mental anguish released from the preserved head causes the creature to become {@condition confused} for 2 rounds.

bot.name: Slosh
entries: Whenever the cranium preserver ends a {@action Stride}, the movement causes necrotic embalming fluid and preserved body parts to slosh about and spill from its central vat. Each creature adjacent to the cranium preserver when it finishes its {@action Stride} must attempt a DC 26 Will save.

Success: The creature takes {@damage 1d8} mental damage and {@damage 1d8} negative damage.
Failure: The creature takes {@damage 2d8} mental damage and {@damage 2d8} negative damage.
Critical Failure: The creature takes {@damage 4d8} mental and {@damage 4d8} negative damage. If the creature is alive, the preserved body parts sense the presence of a living creature and cling to it, causing the creature to become {@condition clumsy||clumsy 2} for 1 round.

attacks.name: blast
attacks.damage: {@damage 3d8+3} fire; this can't cause other pyronite oozes to split

mid.name: Constant Explosions
entries: 5 feet. {@damage 4d6} fire, DC 29 basic Reflex save. This aura can't cause other pyronite oozes to split.

mid.name: Rejoin
entries: If two or more Medium pyronite oozes end their turn in adjacent spaces, they merge into a Large pyronite ooze, combining their current Hit Points.

mid.name: Split
entries: When a Large pyronite ooze is hit by an attack that would deal bludgeoning or fire damage and it has 10 or more HP, it explodes, dealing {@damage 6d6} fire damage to creatures in a 10-foot radius (DC 29 basic Reflex save). This explosion can't cause other pyronite oozes to split. After exploding, the ooze splits into two Medium pyronite oozes, each with half the original's HP, which each fly through the air and land 15 feet from the original ooze in a random direction. If no space is unoccupied where the ooze would land, it automatically pushes creatures and objects out of the way to fill a space (the GM decides if an object or creature is too big or sturdy to push).

bot.name: Exploding Split
entries: The pyronite ooze explodes in a violent conflagration, dealing {@damage 3d6} fire and {@damage 3d6} bludgeoning damage to all creatures in a 30-foot radius (DC 29 basic Reflex save). This explosion can't cause other pyronite oozes to split. After exploding, the ooze splits into two Medium pyronite oozes (see above), but this splitting doesn't deal additional damage.

abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. positive

resistances.name: all
resistances.note: (except force, ghost touch, or positive; double resistance vs. non-magical)

top.name: Floating Corpses
entries: A smog wraith's victims are imbued with an eerie buoyancy; corpses of such creatures float up to 30 feet in the air while inside the wraith's noxious smog aura, though the wraith has no control over the corpse's movement.

mid.name: Noxious Smog
entries: 30 feet.

Creatures within the aura are {@condition concealed}, and creatures outside the aura are {@condition concealed} to creatures within it. A creature that ends its turn within the aura must attempt a DC 25 Fortitude save.

Failure: The creature is {@condition sickened||sickened 1} and {@condition slowed||slowed 1} while within the cloud.
Critical Failure: The creature is {@condition sickened||sickened 2} and {@condition slowed||slowed 1} while within the cloud.

mid.name: Sunlight Powerlessness
entries: A smog wraith caught in sunlight is {@condition stunned||stunned 2} and {@condition clumsy||clumsy 2}.

bot.name: Smog Wraith Spawn
entries: A living humanoid slain by a smog wraith's noxious hand {@action Strike} rises as a smog wraith spawn after {@dice 1d4} rounds.

This spawn is under the command of the smog wraith that killed it. It doesn't have noxious smog or smog wraith spawn and becomes {@condition clumsy||clumsy 2} for as long as it's a smog wraith spawn. If the creator of the spawn dies, the spawn becomes a full-fledged, autonomous smog wraith; it regains its free will, gains smog wraith spawn and noxious smog, and is no longer {@condition clumsy}.

mid.name: Electricity Absorption For
entries: 1 minute after taking electricity damage, a shock zombie loses its usual {@condition slowed||slowed 1} condition, gains the ability to use reactions, and gains a +10-foot status bonus to its Speed.

mid.name: Lightning Powered
entries: Arcs of restorative electricity jolt between shock zombies. For each shock zombie within 30 feet, the shock zombie gains fast healing 2 (to a maximum of fast healing 10).

mid.name: Slow
entries: A shock zombie is typically {@condition slowed||slowed 1} and can't use reactions (but see electricity absorption above).

creature.name: Anjelique Loveless
items: blazons of shared power (attached to pistol and reinforced stock; Guns & Gears 183)

mid.name: Stubborn Resolve
mid.trigger: Anjelique fails or critically fails a saving throw
entries: Anjelique treats a critical failure as a failure, or a failure as a success.

bot.name: Firearms Critical Specialization When
entries: Anjelique makes a critical hit with a firearm, the target must succeed a DC 34 Fortitude save or be {@condition stunned||stunned 1}.

bot.name: Lawbringer's Pursuit
entries: Anjelique Strides and then either Interacts to reload her gun or makes an {@skill Intimidation} check to {@action Demoralize} a foe.

bot.name: Mentor's Curse
entries: The grace of Anjelique's champion mentor inhabits the redeemer's pistol she carries, passing judgment on her actions. If she attempts to make a redeemer's pistol {@action Strike} against a good-aligned creature, she must succeed at a DC {@flatDC 5} flat check or the gun misfires (Guns & Gears 107).

bot.name: Parting Shot
bot.trigger: Anjelique would die or gain the {@condition dying} condition
entries: Anjelique reloads her currently wielded firearm if necessary and makes a ranged {@action Strike} against an enemy, treating a successful attack as a critical hit. Whether successful or not, after making this attack, Anjelique dies.

bot.name: Plant Pyronite Charge
entries: After making a successful melee {@action Strike} against a creature, Anjelique makes a {@skill Thievery} check against the target's {@skill Perception} DC. On a success, she activates and secretly plants a specially formulated sticky pyronite charge on the creature.

This charge detonates after 3 rounds, dealing {@damage 4d8} fire damage to all creatures within a 10-foot radius (DC 34 basic Reflex save) and detonating any other pyronite charges within the area. After making a successful ranged {@action Strike} against a creature stuck with a planted charge, Anjelique can choose to shoot a bullet through the charge, dealing normal damage and detonating the charge immediately. A creature can use an {@action Interact} action to find and remove a planted charge from itself or an adjacent creature. These pyronite charges have the {@trait infused} trait and are inert until activated by Anjelique.

bot.name: Tormenting Shot
entries: Anjelique makes a ranged {@action Strike} and deals an additional {@damage 2d8} piercing damage on a hit. If the target is {@condition frightened}, it also takes {@damage 2d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage} on a hit.

creature.name: Ibrium

mid.name: Vitrumantic Stoneskin
mid.trigger: An adjacent creature Strikes Ibrium with a melee weapon or unarmed attack and deals damage
mid.requirements: Ibrium has a {@spell stoneskin} spell currently active
entries: Ibrium's unique {@spell stoneskin} spell manifests as a protective layer of deadly sharp glass. Glass shards burst out from Ibrium's skin, dealing {@damage 3d10} piercing damage to the attacker.

bot.name: Vitrumancy
entries: Ibrium has modified certain spells to incorporate glass into their manifestation. Whenever Ibrium casts fireball, hydraulic push, or pummeling rubble, the spell deals slashing damage instead of its normal damage type as the damaging component is replaced with shards of razor-sharp glass.

creature.description: Male human vitrumancer and Nexian agent

creature.name: Parsus
items: clockwork key to clockwork bomb in area F8

abilities: +2 status to saves vs. disease and mental

bot.name: Clockwork Necromancy
entries: Parsus winds their necromechanical innovation (see below) to infuse a corpse-riddled area with necromantic energy. The innovation casts black tentacles on a point within 100 feet, causing the dead body parts in a 10-foot burst to briefly animate and scrabble at creatures within the area for 1 round.

bot.name: Explode
entries: Parsus pushes their necromechanical innovation beyond its normal limits, dealing {@damage 10d6} negative damage in a 10-foot emanation (DC 31 basic Reflex save). Parsus can choose to include themself in this effect.

bot.name: Necromatic Winding
entries: Parsus winds up their necromechanical innovation. They choose an active effect with the {@trait necromancy} trait that originated from one of their spells or abilities (such as Clockwork Necromancy). The effect's duration extends to the end of Parsus's next turn.

bot.name: Necromechanical Innovation
entries: Although a necromancer by training, Parsus recently developed a complex device called a necromechanical innovation. This device allows Parsus to use their Clockwork Necromancy, {@action Explode|G&G}, and Necromatic Winding abilities. It otherwise functions as an inventor weapon innovation (Guns & Gears 18) with no modifications.
